roiExplanation: Captured MEP installations behind drywall across 14 floors before close-up. Identified 23 routing conflicts that would have required demolition to fix post-occupancy.
Provided stakeholder portal with 360° progress photos across 4 towers. Reduced disputed change orders by 34% through visual documentation of site conditions.
Forensic documentation of construction defects in luxury residential finishes provided definitive evidence for $12M dispute resolution. Documentation covered 104 units across 42 floors.
Weekly drone aerial surveys of active airside construction enabled real-time progress tracking without disrupting operations. Identified 3 schedule conflicts 2 weeks early.
Documented MEP installations in active hospital environment where access post-completion is impossible. Prevented 17 coordination failures between medical gas and HVAC systems.
Continuous 360° documentation during occupied renovation provided irrefutable visual record for 41 disputed change orders from tenant interference claims.
Point cloud scanning of existing terminal structure before demolition phases. Identified 8 structural conflicts between new steel and existing foundations, preventing costly field modifications.
Comprehensive forensic documentation of clean room and radiation shielding installations satisfied Joint Commission requirements and prevented 6-month commissioning delay.
Monthly drone surveys replaced 3-person ground inspection team for multi-building campus progress reports. Reduced reporting cycle from 5 days to 1 day.
Laser scanning of existing 1960s structure revealed 31 undocumented conditions that conflicted with new MEP routing. Early detection prevented an estimated 4-week schedule delay.
